Speaker: nicholas
Dialogue: Sure.  Change your mind; get inclined?  Let me know...

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: Backup in case the Russians get physical.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: How lucky's Miss Universe gotta be?

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: Skin has to touch skin.  That's the requirement for the warrant.  Then he makes a credible excuse and he stops....  Her crew blackmailed and asset- stripped the last mark down to his social security...

Speaker: gina
Dialogue: This I gotta see...  ...the "make up an excuse and stop" part.

Speaker: gina
Dialogue: I have faith.  In horoscopes and fortune cookies...

Speaker: gina
Dialogue: Switek pulling this off...?  That's not faith; that's delusional...

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Yeah.  This is their surveillance...how they video their marks?  See, we jacked their fiber optics, like we piggybacked their signal.  Get it?

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: If a coupla new exhaust manifolds show up...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Gin and Tonic.  Plymouth or Boodles.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Lemon doesn't go in Gin and Tonics, darlin'.  Where ya' from?

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: You in Miami workin' on your complexion...?

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: With the United Nations High Commission on Refugees.  Famine relief.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Really?  I did refugee relocation in Somalia.  But they transferred me out after I was wounded...

Speaker: gina
Dialogue: Only African he ever "relocated" was a $2,000-an-hour Nigerian model for Gucci, and he got wounded when she took an NBA draft choice to the Super Bowl instead of him...

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: ...to backup Switek.  But only if it gets lethal.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: The honey trap.  And there's the honey.

Speaker: trudy
Dialogue: Eleven to seven he blows it.

Speaker: trudy
Dialogue: You're giving away your money, fool...

Speaker: zito
Dialogue: Sure.  Switek versus primal impulse from the amygdala.  Higher thinking versus the lizard brain.  Tectonic plates of libido confront the cognitive.

Speaker: gina
Dialogue: Oh, bullshit.  She cops his joint. He pushes the button.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: What are you talking about?  Where are you...?

Speaker: stevens
Dialogue: They had me from the gate.

Speaker: stevens
Dialogue: I gave up nothing on you guys. Don't worry.  I kept you and Rico out of it.  Only the Feds.  They're on their own...it's all their deal, anyway, so fuck 'em.

Speaker: stevens
Dialogue: After I check on Francine and the boys, then I'm gone.  Sonny, tell Rico I'm so sorry.  I wanted you to know...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: This is Detective Crockett.  Miami- Dade P.D.  Patch me through to your Special Agent in Charge, James Fujima?  It's an emergency...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: I said, "emergency."  If he's not reachable, who's running the weekend?  The ASAC?

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: I don't know...we haven't worked with him for six months...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: A C.I. we cut loose to your Joint Interagency Task Force.  Name of Alonzo Stevens.  Now, he's YOUR informant.  Stevens, called us.  I haven't spoken to him for six months. I do not know what case you have him on.  I do not know what he is talking about.  But whatever he is doing for you, it sounds like it is going bad.  Right now...

Speaker: fujima
Dialogue: How do I discuss operations over an open line?

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: How do I know?  But we know this guy.  I think you know this guy.  Normally, he is cool.  Tonight he is distraught. That is atypical.  That engenders foreboding.  Do you understand the meaning of the word "foreboding"? As in badness is happening to your deal right fucking now?

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: "Buy and walk"?  "Buy and bust"? "Reverse undercover"?  What?

Speaker: fujima
Dialogue: Meet and greet.  "I flash you some of mine, you flash me some of yours?"

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: And the deal goes down at another place at another time.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: ...so there's no industrial- strength HRT weapons team out there tonight?

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: OMGs, Mongols, Nazi Low-Riders, prison gangs?

Speaker: fujima
Dialogue: NLR, we think.  I wanna know...

Speaker: fujima
Dialogue: ...what else, what else did he indicate to you?  I need to know everything he said.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: He is saying they had him from the gate.  He is saying to my partner and I and to his family "goodbye." What does that tell you?

Speaker: russian
Dialogue: Never seen money before?  This is called "money."

Speaker: aryan brother
Dialogue: Hey, Ivan!  I forgot to ask you something, my brother...

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: What the hell did you do?

Speaker: stevens
Dialogue: The Feeb gig was I front a coupla undercover, Russian-speakers to them.  One's ATF.  And broker the deal.  Set up the meet with the NLR types...

Speaker: stevens
Dialogue: How do I know?  But it was from the get-go.  Knew the FBI had run me into them.  Sonny, I gotta go...!

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: Alonzo, you don't need to go home.

Speaker: stevens
Dialogue: They said they wouldn't hurt them, wouldn't hurt them if...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: They been known to do that...

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: Quarter mile away.  We see the lights...

Speaker: fujima
Dialogue: We think NLR.  We don't know! Alonzo only fronted as a broker for our guys to make the meet.  He wasn't deep into the crew.

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: White gangs is tweakers and a crystal meth lab in a trailer park. Bounce around the old lady Saturday night and get your recidivist ass busted back...

Speaker: fujima
Dialogue: Not anymore.  This is a distribution network out of South Florida, moving poly-drug loads, crystal meth through coke, to Nashville, Atlanta, Memphis, Cleveland.  And computer fraud, identity theft. It's like that.

Speaker: fujima
Dialogue: They knew about Alonzo, before he made a move on them.  They had our operation.  They've cut into us.

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: Break your encryption?  Hack your e- mail?  Employee databases? Somebody on the inside?

Speaker: fujima
Dialogue: We don't know.  And that's the point.  Maybe there's a mole. Whatever, it's a disaster.  And it's a Joint Interagency Task Force.  I have DEA, ATF, U.S. Customs components in on it.  So the penetration could be from any one agency.  What we do know is I have to suspend operations right now from undercover work through interdictions 'cause I have to assume our Operational Security is blown.

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: As in, your ass is dead in the water.

Speaker: fujima
Dialogue: But Miami PD wasn't part of the J.I.T.  And from what Alonzo said, he didn't give you up.

Speaker: castillo
Dialogue: ...I didn't want you around the crime scene because it's crawling with federal law enforcement.  We don't know who's straight up, who's not...

Speaker: fujima
Dialogue: Get into business with this crew, identify them.  Illuminate their network.  If you're lucky, discover their source, how they penetrated us.  We'll indict and take it from there...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: How do we do that?  Make a buy?  That went well...

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: Reverse undercover?  WE supply to them?

Speaker: fujima
Dialogue: They got a steady stream of supply. So, no...

Speaker: fujima
Dialogue: A Colombian producer.  Named Archangel de Jesus Montoya-Londono.

Speaker: fujima
Dialogue: From the North Valle area.  New. Low-level, we think.

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: Aryan brothers are not going to change-up suppliers.  So...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Transpo?  How they bringing the loads in...?

Speaker: fujima
Dialogue: They're not.  They collect in Miami.  Montoya, the producer, handles deliveries.  That's his end, and he varies the routes.  We got some FLIR off an AWAC of a coupla go-fast boats, on one run, that's all.

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: Track with me, here...  What does that say to you?

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: It says, "Fuck off and die."  It says, "We get down for recreation..."

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: We could try to run loads into these guys.  Run a few loads for Montoya into South Florida.  Into this group.

Speaker: fujima
Dialogue: You need to consider a few issues.

Speaker: castillo
Dialogue: And you will share with them all your intel on Montoya...

Speaker: fujima
Dialogue: Of course.  From my side, I don't WANT to know anything about what you're doing or how you do it...  So let me know if we're on...

Speaker: castillo
Dialogue: About the Stevens family, I'm sorry.  I know you were close to them.

Speaker: castillo
Dialogue: I got to know.  There is never any room for "personal"...

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: And the answer is "yes."  You bet it was personal.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Three wakes off the back of those boats.  Who runs three Sterling engines off a deep-V hull?

Speaker: castillo
Dialogue: So what's gonna persuade Montoya to change off Sal Maguda running his deliveries...?

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: Yeah?  Okay.  Only Jean-Louis and I do the talking...

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: Que faisons-nous?  De qu'a-t-il l'air, fou!  Nous voulons tous votre drugs.

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: Hey, Nicholas, my ace.  Wha's up?

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: We got idle all of an instant.  You got something from somewhere that's got to go someplace, somewhen, which is not too distantly in the future...?

Speaker: nicholas
Dialogue: It is fortuitous that you called...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: We're from Nicholas to meet Jos...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Sonny Burnett...this is my partner, Rico.

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: So lay it out, my brother...

Speaker: jos yero
Dialogue: Nicholas said you okay.  That's nice.  But how I know if you any good?

Speaker: jos yero
Dialogue: Who you run loads for?  Cause other than Nicholas, you knows you?

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: My mommy and daddy know me.

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: And we didn't come down here to audition.  Business auditions for us...  ...and know who we are and know they want their load run by us before Nicholas calls.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: That way we do not waste AvGas or our motherfucking time.

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: People gonna walk into this place and say, "Ola, hijo!  That some crazy wallpaper.  Whew...it wild! Is that a Jackson Pollack?"

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: "No, viejo.  That was Jos Yero, splattered all over his motherfucking wall."

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: So we can close each other's eyes right now.  Real easy.  Real fast.  But, then, nobody makes any money...

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: Slow and low, Adam A-500s...  ...carbon composite, stealthy, 1400 nautical-mile range, thousand ki payload...all the way to Caravels and 727's from a source country to a transshipment point.  Small freighters.  We've done containers...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: And specialize in very fast go-fast boats for coastal runs.

Speaker: jos yero
Dialogue: We don't talk weight.  We talk logistics.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: The people on shore who handle a load we run are our people, not your people.  No tweakers, dopers, first- timers we don't know.  They didn't do time with us, they ain't doing crime with us.

Speaker: jos yero
Dialogue: Nothing.  'Cause how you do delivery on the beach, I don't like.  Maybe this does not work.

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: What happened to the last transporter you had?

Speaker: jos yero
Dialogue: Other people will negotiate the money and go or not go.  Not me...

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: Then what were we talking to you for?

Speaker: jos yero
Dialogue: I had to lay eyes on you.

Speaker: jos yero
Dialogue: But him?  I don't like... how he looks...

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: What do I care what you think about how he looks?  You wanna fuck my partner or do business?

Speaker: jos yero
Dialogue: Wait by the phone.  You get a call.  Or maybe you don't.  Until then, piss off back to where you come from...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Hi, Gina.  This is from Frick and Frack. Trudy?

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Satellite.  New encryption. Supposedly sharper than the G...  How good's our background?

Speaker: gina
Dialogue: You're so not the PD, if you got busted on a DUI, you're in serious trouble...you're bad men back to grammar school.  Marine Corps.  Statesville. Pelican Bay, where you guys hooked up.  Now you're too smart and too fast to get jacked again...

Speaker: gina
Dialogue: If they ran the rental car or lease on this place...even if it's EPIC database in El Paso...they'd have to work through the layers of bullshit three weeks deep.  Then they'd find your deeper, hidden criminal selves...

Speaker: gina
Dialogue: What am I supposed to do after I get my nails and hair done...?

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: Reality TV and stay by the phone. That's what all wives-in-crime do...

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: They watching us watching them watching us waiting for them?  Or what?

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Really?  So, what is this, a party?

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: We'll have room service wipe up the furniture...and bring drinks.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Glad we came.  This place is a lot of fun if you're Doctors Without Borders.  So...?

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: I run down the numbers.  Nothing is very negotiable.  Small loads?  We pay three thousand a ki. We pay your fuel costs up front plus ten percent.  The next ten percent on U.S. landfall.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Two, three thousand a ki. Two thousand ki's, your end is $6,000,000.  That's the deal.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: I thought we had to meet the Man.

Speaker: montoya
Dialogue: Please take that seat on the side...

Speaker: montoya
Dialogue: If you are arrested, there will be lawyers made available to you in the United States.  You will use them.  Anything you need, you will be provided by me.  It cost you nothing.  You will contact and work through Jos Yero on logistics and communications.  To do with money, you will work through my wife, Isabella...

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: Nothing.  Calling to say hi... What's up with you?

Speaker: gina
Dialogue: The bouquet, here.  Five-hundred dollars worth of roses...yellow.

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: Good idea.  We'll grab a bite.

Speaker: gina
Dialogue: ...the lease, the phones, the cars...layers of false ident. Would take the FBI weeks.  How long did it take them?  Three hours? Four?  This means, "We can reach out and touch somebody."  Like Bad Teleflora.

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: ...even if they could run the identities you built to EPIC, all they'll find is more cover... Trust what you built.  It's quality, girl.  We're cool...

Speaker: gina
Dialogue: I am careful.  I am cool.  I got Trudy, backup, whatever.  You worry about you.  Because you are the ones who are in denied territory, not me.  If your focus is on me, you'll miss something coming at you.  That's how people slip up. Get hurt.  And I'd die if anything happened.  You worry about you. You and Sonny...are in the dangerous place.  I'm fine...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: You worried about the tree line, US Customs AWACS, or something else on your mind?

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Gina in the Miami pad.  You gonna give me phony denials?

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: No.  You gonna give me phony reassurances?

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Usually his thing is street dealers.  Torture their families until they cough up the stash. This...?

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: "Extras" tried to relieve us of your weight...  And by the by, you know of a player in Overtown who goes by the name of "Things Aquatic"?

Speaker: jos yero
Dialogue: I do.  We don't do business with him...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: He tried to..."do business"...with you.  Around ten.  His place.  Be there.

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: This the load you lost a while back?

Speaker: jos yero
Dialogue: It is.  He try to take tonight's load?

Speaker: jos yero
Dialogue: And what do I do with him?

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: Whatever you want.  Like we said, we're not into violence.

Speaker: jos yero
Dialogue: I walk into Neptune's house...very nice.  But I also see you... and our drugs that got ripped from Maguda.

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: You don't like us finding your load?  We can go and lose it all over again...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: How 'bout this?  How'd Neptune know where to hit us?  Huh?  Whose Op sec's got a leak?  Yours?

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: He didn't.  Interrogation's not in our skill set.  So c'mon, what suspicions have you master-minded off these associations?

Speaker: jos yero
Dialogue: Here's what this is...ask how much they want to turn back to us our load...

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: What's the recovery?  How much are you looking for?

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: And as an investment in the future...

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: It's yours cause what's yours, is yours.  And what's ours is ours...  ...like the second ten-percent, which is now due, Yero, my ace.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Give them the shipment on the seventeenth...

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Maritime.  Jose will fill you in.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: There is one thing you can do for me in recognition of the death- defying risks we took to recover your product...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Let me buy you a drink.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: What do you like to drink?

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: Can I talk to you for a second, partner...?

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: ...secure satellite comms. encrypted e-mail, the longs and lats for the transshipment point...all that?  It's all cool. But I need a vector, not a location.  'Cause ships move. That's why they call them ships. Ship stops?  It's trying to be an apartment building.  At sea that attracts attention.  That's bad...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: So where's the best place for mojitas?

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Bodeguita del Medio.  It's the only place for mojitas...

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Off a little alley with cobblestones.  Hemingway went there...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Havana?  Cubans don't like us or my business...

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Are you afraid?  Good.  And you don't need a visa. Cause you're with me.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Light touch.  Everything comes to you through the wheel.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: My cousin is the harbor master. You must not bring in drugs.  You cannot be armed.  If you're carrying, it has to go.  Or stow it inside.  No one will go near your boat...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: You do business in Cuba with your husband?

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: I never do business in Cuba.  And he is not my husband...

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Angola.  My mother was being a surgeon there.  She volunteered. Mozambique and Mali, too...  ...those days, in those days...she was part of Cuba's gift to the third world.  She came from a bourgeois family with a house in Verdado...we still have the house. We will go there...

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Angolan Military.  Went back to the fighting.  Disappeared.  Who knows...?

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: I am no one's wife.  I live in my own house.  I do not live in a man's house.  He has a wife.  We are together.  I am free.  Because of banking and finance and travel...  And I can do anything I want...

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: My aunt.  She's ancient.  She looks after the place...  This was my mother's family's home...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Macon, Georgia is where I was born. Wound up in a juvenile facility.  I was 14.  Then the military.  Then prison.  Because I was dumb and angry.  Then I read.  Then I got smart.  Then I discovered what I know, now...it's all business...

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Blanca...a rubio like you.  Your mother?

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: To mothers.  And all that we owe them...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: You know how improbable this is...?

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: "Probable"...applies to an event that may be real.  Doesn't apply here.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: ...'cause we have no future...are of today and not tomorrow.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Like "three thousand a ki?"  That's nice. And I can supply the transportation into South Florida and the Gulf, more reliable and on-time than FedEx.  But, three per ki was OK for openers.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: And why should continuing excellence cost more?

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Did Christmas come early this year...?

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Better than that.  We become partners.  Only in this territory and only on loads we run. And you don't pay us three thousand a ki.  You pay us zero.  Why we get is thirty percent of the load. Product or cash.  "And why," you're thinking, "would I be crazy enough to out in these gringos like that? Is he chipping?  Crazy for my love? Too many mojitas?"  And the answer is, "of course" but also "no.  It is because Sonny can deliver what no one else can."

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: 'Cause we guarantee every load.  Anywhere, for any reason, it comes up short, we make good.  Your operations will, from now on, run risk-free.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Then I would say to you, this has been fun...

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: The range should be between fifteen and seventeen-point-five percent of the P.O.E....to even consider it.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: I need thirty.  Calculate in, also, the cash you don't have to front...

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Available cash is not an issue for us...

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: What if I pushed to twenty-one...?

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: I would say you're...  ...four percentage points away from a deal...

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: And now I make you breakfast again...

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: The meet with Castillo and the fed got set up.  It's in 45 minutes...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Hit a couple of jazz clubs.  Fell back to her place.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: It's in the suburbs outside Havana.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: No.  Havana, Louisiana.  Don't we have a meet?

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: ...where you're makin' a move on the wife of Archangel de Jesus Montoya?

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: You're not makin' a move on her...?

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: We're makin' moves on each other.

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: Oh, that makes it okay, then.

Speaker: fujima
Dialogue: Who said, "go exploring"?  We want this staying on track.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Who's the "we"?  There's you and there's us.  And all we got from you was bad intel.  "Low-level producer."  Yeah, right...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Montoya.  We went to meet the village priest.  It turns into Alice in the fucking Vatican and here's the Pope...of the North Valle Colombia dope trade.

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: His operations are kingpin size and first-class.  His security is ex- Eastern bloc, ex-SAS and Israelis. Their comms are satellite uplink with mainframe encryption, significant Sig Int and in their zones of activity, they have signal- jamming capability...

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: And what does that level of spending on first-class, private- sector infrastructure signify to you?

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Haiti and Puerto Rico.  Money through Dubai and Geneva maybe.

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: Their loads are poly-drug.  "E" from Holland, methamphetamine precursors from Jordan, Afghan "H." Mid-ocean transshipments.  His real business is:  he's a network.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: And we can illuminate part of it from the inside out.

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: So we want to change-up the mission statement.

Speaker: fujima
Dialogue: Identify and indict the white supremacist group of importers. End of story.  Everything else I'm hearing is speculation masquerading as intel...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Keys to the boat.  Go do this motherfucker yourself.

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: He's talking to you, bro.  What he means to say is he is reluctant to abandon the penetration of a major narcotrafficking organization...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: We're the ones doing the death- defying shit?  And he wants us to give that up?  For what? A chump-change bust so he can get his picture in The Miami Herald to impress the slug farm in DC...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: I'm my own man.  And anytime you want to see how much man I am?

Speaker: castillo
Dialogue: Then that's it.  Change the mission statement. Crockett stays in.  He keeps working up the ladder.  The local importers get a pass for the time being.

Speaker: fujima
Dialogue: I got to talk to my ADO...

Speaker: castillo
Dialogue: No, you don't, Jim.  'Cause if I close this down, you got nothing to make a phone call about.  And my guys don't have a week for a Feeb bureaucratic process.  Every hour longer they're in there, they risk exposure.  So, right here, right now, they're back in or I pull them out and close you down.  What's it going to be?

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: There is "undercover."  And there is "Which way is up?"

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: You think I am in so deep I forgot?

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: I am asking.  You to me.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Do you believe...I have forgotten I am a cop?

Speaker: montoya
Dialogue: Precursor shipments from Ras Tanura and Ju'aymah?

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Transshipped to a Malaysian container ship.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: They've been targeted.  And Pakistani registry is too vulnerable to search and seizure right now.

Speaker: montoya
Dialogue: Jos doesn't like the deal in South Florida...

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: They want 22% of the value on loads they run into South Florida.  It's the Juarez cartel model. They guarantee the loads.  The upside is our risk goes to zero. That frees-up capital.

Speaker: montoya
Dialogue: But what does your intuition tell you...?

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: My "intuition"...?  My intuition made him breakfast the other morning in Havana.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: They're serious.  They're cautious. They'll forgo a deal over a technicality of how a delivery's handled...they'd walk away, rather than compromise operational security...that's good.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: A good deal, like this with us, for Burnett will be good only temporarily.  He'll get restless because he believes nothing is forever.  Life is dust, make it while you can.  He's ambitious.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: I think Jos suspects anybody he doesn't intimidate.  And people, who are good at what they do?  They have egos, too...

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: I like the diminished risk.  It frees up capital reserves.  I like working with self-interested businessmen who are competent.  You can predict their behavior....

Speaker: montoya
Dialogue: Let's try a few runs with these partners, I think.  I will tell Jos...

Speaker: jos yero
Dialogue: They are "wrong."  I do not trust them.

Speaker: jos yero
Dialogue: Too good at what they do, I don't know.  Something I don't like. They are wrong...

Speaker: jos yero
Dialogue: Transshipment point is here at 17:00 hours on the 23rd.

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: Uh-uh.  No predetermined places and times to meet.  Give me their heading and radio codes and I will talk to them directly with the longs and lats and time which will be a last minute deal...

Speaker: jos yero
Dialogue: You give yours to me.  We position all the assets hauling our loads...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Now how we do it, blood.  It risks signal interception and other bad things like people who don't need to know where we're at knowing.

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: At ten to three on the 27th, I will satellite page him with a website and encryption code.  He will have ten minutes to log on and receive his new heading.  Ten minutes and thirty seconds, website disappears and he can drive his fucking boat up to Iceland...

Speaker: jos yero
Dialogue: Malaysian registry.  Small containership.  Give them their codes and heading.

Speaker: jos yero
Dialogue: Fifty-gallon drums.  Thirty-two.  A hundred kilos in each.  You transship that to the Malaysian boat.

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: Importation value?  At twenty-two thousand a ki...

Speaker: jos yero
Dialogue: You work that out with La Senora.  I'm sure you have friends with fast boats...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: If you see a few new faces, don't get jumpy...

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: And Jos, my ace, lots of transshipment.  Lots of action. Skies are crowded.  And the JIT has assets on land, air, and sea.  So any intel you got that can come our way and contribute to the good and welfare...?

Speaker: jos yero
Dialogue: You know what Escobar used to do?

Speaker: jos yero
Dialogue: And do you know why Pablo Escobar did that?

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: And the chopsticks and fortune cookies?

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: What's the best fortune you ever got?

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: They're all the same.  "Financial security is around the corner." "Your friends love you."

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: In Kowloon, once, I got one that said, "Live now because life is dust."

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Do you have assets somewhere else? Bank accounts?

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: ...to fall back on.  You know, a fail-safe.  Insurance.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Everybody needs it.  Ask Prudential.  Or Allstate.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Something like that.  The odds catch up with you.  The odds are like gravity.  You can't negotiate with them.  So...at some point, you should cash out, take your money and run...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Sure.  As far away and as fast as you can.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Zanzibar.  The Comoros Islands. Somewhere in the Indian Ocean. There's twelve-hundred islands there...

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Is this the protective male talk?

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: This is the talk of a man...if he were your husband...he would never put you at risk.  He would never put you within a thousand miles of anything that could hurt you.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: And if I were in the Comoros, in the Indian Ocean, where would you be...?

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: A few more moments, still in this business.  Then I'd find you.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Would you?  Because if you couldn't, I would be very lonely... I would have left the only world I know and have known since I was seventeen.  But none of this will happen.  So it doesn't matter.  Because we are on the Guajira Peninsula.  And all you see around you...look around... is Archangel de Jesus Montoya- Londono.  He is my man.  And you are a smuggler moving a load...

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: I'll be on board by noon.

Speaker: trudy
Dialogue: Too fast.  Too many moving parts.

Speaker: switek
Dialogue: Same.  But it's your call, boss.

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: What's the point?  It's going down.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Call the US Coast Guard:  "Come and arrest our ass."  And Switek resumes romancing Miss Ukraine...

Speaker: trudy
Dialogue: If we were for real, and knew our shit, we'd fade this one...

Speaker: trudy
Dialogue: If you're down, we're down for the play.

Speaker: el tiburon
Dialogue: Meth precursors and the Dutch party favors are en route.

Speaker: coleman
Dialogue: All I want to know is the where and the when.  Spare me mini moves, progress reports and bullshit.

Speaker: el tiburon
Dialogue: And our friend don't like the rest of the people bringin' the merch to you.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: You got something to say, Jos, let's hear it.

Speaker: jos yero
Dialogue: I confess I have succumbed to my weaknesses.  An inability to see another's point of view.  I've discussed it with professionals.  Even with one of your friends.  She's here now...

Speaker: jos yero
Dialogue: Mrs. Rico.  But don't worry.  She is safe.  To insure that, I am keeping her close to me.  It's always good to keep people your friends care about close to you.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Proof of life.  How do I know Mrs. Rico's alive?

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Of course!  That is why I placed myself here, with you, knowing Yero would pull this crap.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: It's all bullshit.  Jesus is out of communication in Fals de Iguazu. Jos knows that...  Whatever he's going to do, he has to do it fast because he's acting on his own. And he will need a story.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: They will kill you.  And then they will kill your wife, too.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Maybe.  Maybe with the crazy whites.

Speaker: trudy
Dialogue: Gina.  Like Alonzo's wife...  Cochi Loco's got her.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Dump the rest.  Let's get the boats up that river.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Jos Yero changed-up the drop plan on us.  He's grabbed Gina.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: They'll have surveillance on us. We'll know only at the last moment...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: It's a rip and a hit.

Speaker: castillo
Dialogue: We'll be airborne and assault the ambush...

Speaker: castillo
Dialogue: They may have already, so we protect the living.  Proof she's alive?

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: They're proving it's right now. And that she's alive right now...

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: Smell.  Bad smell.  Trailer...  She's allergic to diethylene...she in a meth lab?

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Just came in.  She's still alive.

Speaker: castillo
Dialogue: Safe house is empty...  Air Support's set to jump when we know your drop point.  Gina?

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: She's sending a message.  Meth Lab. Trailer park.  Anything with interesting antenna arrays...?

Speaker: castillo
Dialogue: There's three between Miami International and the glades.  I'm gonna try for her, but this is triage.  Protect the maximum number of lives.  You need to know that...

Speaker: tubbs
Dialogue: Trudy and I are goin' for Gina...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: ...it's gonna be an L-shaped ambush.  They're not gonna open up until they got the party favors, 'cause all they'd get is a lot of police scrambling to a gunfight. They will wait till they got the goods before they do the deed.

Speaker: trudy
Dialogue: Have eyes on her.  She's alive. Moving in...

Speaker: aryan brother
Dialogue: Shoot me, she dies.  Hey, fuck it, man.  We can all go.

Speaker: trudy
Dialogue: ...what will happen is, I will put a round precisely through the medula at the base of your brain, at an entry-point mid-distance between your upper lip and the bottom of your nose, and you will be dead from the neck down.  Your finger won't be able to twitch.  Do you believe that?

Speaker: yero
Dialogue: Isabella.  The gringos are police. She's their informant...!

Speaker: pa
Dialogue: Freeze!  You're under arrest.  Down on your knees.  Put your hands on your head...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Touch the windshield with your hands.  Let 'em see your hands are empty.  Steady.

Speaker: swat sergeant
Dialogue: Don't move!  Don't move!  Keep your hands where I can see them...

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Yeah.  Going to Miami General. Check out Gina.  Everybody's okay. Everybody's fine...

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: What are you going to do with me? Are you taking me to jail?  You think I will turn into your informant, is that it?

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: No part of it wasn't real.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: It still is.  I'm so in this, I don't know which way is up... All I know is I won't let anything bad happen to you.  And I know we can't ever see each other again.  And we never will.

Speaker: crockett
Dialogue: Luck ran out.  This was too good to last.
